scenarios.title: Vendor on the Board
scenarios.description: A Director owns a company bidding on a services contract up for Board approval.
scenarios.question: What should occur?

options.A: Director participates and votes to show transparency
options.B: Director discloses and recuses; independent Directors review comparable data
options.C: Proceed without disclosure to avoid delays
options.D: Director negotiates price during the meeting

scenarios.explanation: Disclosure, recusal, and independent review with documentation are required safeguards.

scenarios.title: Compensation Committee Member
scenarios.description: A committee member is being considered for a paid consulting engagement with the Corporation.
scenarios.question: How should the approval process be handled?

options.B: Member discloses, recuses, and independent members approve in advance using comparables
options.C: CEO sets the rate without Board involvement

scenarios.explanation: Advance approval, independence, comparable data, and minutes are required.

scenarios.title: Gift with Strings
scenarios.description: A potential vendor offers sports tickets to a Key Employee during an active RFP.
scenarios.question: What is the most appropriate response?
scenarios.explanation: Gifts that may influence judgment should be declined and disclosed.

scenarios.title: Business Opportunity
scenarios.description: A Director learns of a grant opportunity aligned with the mission and plans to apply personally.
scenarios.question: What should they do first?

options.A: Apply personally then inform the Board
options.B: Disclose to the Board; allow the Board to accept/decline before personal pursuit
